Presenoldeb / Attendance

Gan fod yr ysgol yn cychwyn am 8.45 y bore disgwylir i'ch plentyn fod yn yr ysgol i ddechrau ar ei g/waith erbyn hynny. Fe fydd aelod o staff yn yr ysgol i oruchwylio eich plentyn o 8.35 ymlaen. Nid yw’r ysgol yn gyfrifol am y plant cyn 8.35 y.b. nac ar ôl 3.10 y.h. Cofrestrir ar ddechrau’r sesiwn bore a’r sesiwn prynhawn. Os bydd plentyn yn hwyr ar gyfer cofrestru, cofnodir hynny ar y gofrestr. Fe gaiff y gofrestr ei chau am 9.15 y.b. ac am 1.00 y.h. a bydd unrhyw blentyn a fydd yn cyrraedd ar ôl hyn yn cael ei farcio’n absennol.

Os bydd eich plentyn yn absennol am unrhyw reswm, gofynnwn yn garedig i chwi hysbysu’r ysgol o hynny ar fore cyntaf yr absenoldeb. Bydd yr ysgol yn cysylltu gyda’r rhieni os na fyddwn wedi derbyn eglurhad. Mae'n ddyletswydd yn ôl deddf gwlad i chwi sicrhau fod eich plentyn yn mynychu ysgol, ac mae’r Awdurdod Addysg a'r Llywodraeth yn monitor presenoldeb disgyblion unigol ac ysgol gyfan. Gofynnwn yn garedig i rieni beidio tynnu eu plant o’r ysgol yn ystod y tymor i fynd ar wyliau os oes unrhyw fodd o osgoi hyn.

Fe fydd y Corff Llywodraethol yn hysbysu rhieni'r ysgol yn ysgrifenedig o ganran absenoldeb y plant hefo a heb ganiatâd yn eu Hadroddiad Blynyddol i Rieni.
As school starts at 8.45 in the morning, your child is expected to be in school ready to commence his/her work by that time. A member of staff will be on the premises from 8.35 onwards to supervise your child. The school is not responsible for the children until 8.35 a.m. and not after 3.10 p.m. Pupils are registered at the beginning of the afternoon session. If a child is late for registration, this is recorded on the register. The register is closed at 9.15 a.m. and 1.00 p.m. and any child arriving after this will be recorded as absent.

If your child is absent for any reason we politely ask that you inform the school on the first morning of their absence. The school will contact the parents if we have not received an explaination. You are obliged by law to ensure that your child attends a school and therefore and the Education Authority and the government monitor both the attendance of individual pupils and the whole school. We kindly ask parents not to remove children from school during term time to go on family holidays if it can be at all avoided.

The Governing Body will furnish the parents of the school with a written percentage of absences with and without permission in their Annual Report to Parents.

The Childs Psalm

If a child lives with criticism
- he learns to condemn.

If a child lives with hostility
- he learns to fight.

If a child lives with ridicule
- he learns to be shy.

If a child lives with shame
- he learns to feel guilty.

If a child lives with tolerance
- he learns to be patient.

If a child lives with encouragement
- he learns confidence.

If a child lives with praise
- he learns to appreciate.

If a child lives with fairness
- he learns justice.

If a child lives with security
- he learns to have faith.

If a child lives with approval
- he learns to like himself.

If a child lives with acceptance and friendship
He learns to find love in the world.

Athroniaeth

Mae'r ysgol yn bodoli i ddathlu cyflawniadau plant ac i’w datblygu fel unigolion sydd yn gwerthfawrogi eu hamgylchfyd yn ei gyfanrwydd. Rhoddir pwys ar ddatblygu gwerthoedd moesol a dyngarol, gan feithrin hunan-barch a goddefgarwch tuag at eraill. Ymdrechir i sicrhau bod pob disgybl yn teimlo’n hapus a diogel o fewn cymdeithas ddisgybledig sy’n rhoi bri yn ei bywyd a’i gwaith.

Rhoddir pwyslais ar gynnal a chodi safonau cyflawniad disgyblion ym mhob maes cwricwlaidd, er mwyn rhoi’r cyfle i bob disgybl gyrraedd ei lawn botensial, ond rhaid cofio bod cyfrifoldeb gan yr ysgol am fwy nag addysgu’r plant a dylid meddwl amdanynt yn eu cyfanrwydd, fel bodau unigryw a chanddynt eu hanghenion arbennig eu hunain. Mae angen felly datblygu gwerthfawrogiad o'r moesol, y moesgar, y corfforol a’r diwylliannol ac o etifeddiaeth, o draddodiadau ac o iaith y genedl Gymreig a'i lle yn, a'i pherthynas gyda gweddill y byd.

Er mwyn cyflawni hyn rhaid sicrhau bod pob plentyn yn cael cyfle cyfartal ar draws y cwricwlwm. Cyflwynir cwricwlwm eang, cytbwys a chyfoethog i’r plant, gan gynnig iddynt brofiadau real a chyfoethog. Defnyddir dulliau dysgu ac addysgu ac adnoddau o’r ansawdd uchaf, fydd yn cynorthwyo disgyblion i ddatblygu meddyliau ymchwilgar a bywiog, y gallu i gwestiynu a thrafod yn rhesymegol, i ddatrys problemau real ac i weithio'n annibynnol. Ymdrechir i wneud hyn o fewn cynefin ac awyrgylch agored, croesawgar, chwaethus, hapus, teuluol a chartrefol.

Golyga hyn fod y plant yn cael eu hysbrydoli ac er mwyn iddynt gyrraedd a chyflawni eu llawn potensial rhaid addysgu plentyn i addysgu ei hun drwy roi rhan weithredol iddi/o yn y broses honno. Rhaid pwysleisio'r pwysigrwydd o roi clust a sylw teilwng i bawb, gan bawb, a hefyd i blant gael cyfle i ymateb yn synhwyrol a gydag ymresymiad personol i amrywiol gynulleidfaoedd.

Mae'n hanfodol bwysig parchu plant, eu syniadau a'u cynnyrch, drwy rannu eu llwyddiannau ag eraill, a datblygu hunan barch a hyder drwy osod esiampl o'r safon uchaf bosibl.

Er mwyn cyflawni'r hyn oll mae'n rhaid cynllunio'n drwyadl polisïau, cynlluniau a dulliau dysgu ysgol gyfan a dosbarthiadau unigol, wedi ymgynghoriad rhwng a gyda'r athrawon, y llywodraethwyr a'r A.A.Ll

Philosophy

The school exists to celebrate the children’s' achievements and to develop them as individuals who appreciate their environment in its entirety. The development of moral and philanthropic values, as well as self –esteem and tolerance towards others is encouraged. We strive to ensure that each pupil feels happy and secure within a disciplined community, which puts great value in its life and work.

Importance is put on maintaining and raising children’s achievement standards, so that each individual is given the opportunity to achieve his/her full potential, but it must be remembered that the school has a responsibility for more than just teaching children, which means that the children must be considered in their entirety, as unique beings with their own individual needs. It is therefore also necessary to develop an appreciation of the moral, the mannerly, the physical and the cultural, and an understanding of the inheritance, traditions and language of the Welsh nation, and its place in, and relationship to the rest of the world.

In order to achieve this it is necessary to ensure that each child has equal opportunities across the curriculum. The children are offered a varied, balanced and enriched curriculum, with real experiences of the highest possible quality. Teaching and learning techniques and resources of the highest possible quality are used, which encourage children to develop inquisitive and lively minds, the ability to question and to discuss sensibly, to solve problems and to work independently. We strive to do this within an open, welcoming, tasteful, happy, family and homely environment and atmosphere.

This results in children who are inspired and in order that each child achieves his/her full potential, the children must be educated to take an active part in this process. It is necessary to emphasise the importance of listening to what children have to say, and that everyone gives each child his/her deserved attention, and that each child be given the opportunity to react sensibly and with personal reasoning to varying audiences.

It is essential that each child and his/her ideas and produce be respected, by sharing their successes with others, by developing self-respect and confidence and by setting an example of the highest possible quality.

In order to achieve all this, it is necessary to prepare thoroughly, policies, whole school and class schemes and teaching techniques, after consultation within and between the staff, governors and LEA.

Llywodraethwyr / Governors

Mae modd i rieni i ofyn am hyd at 3 chyfarfod gyda Chorff Llywodraethu mewn unrhyw flwyddyn ysgol, i drafod materion sy’n peri pryder iddynt. Bydd rhaid bodloni 4 gofyniad:
Bydd angen i rieni gyflwyno deiseb o blaid cynnal cyfarfod.

  • Bydd angen i rieni o leiaf 10% o ddisgyblion cofrestredig yr ysgol / 30 o ddisgyblion cofrestredig lofnodi’r ddeiseb.
  • Rhaid galw’r cyfarfod i drafod materion sy’n effeithio ar yr ysgol.
  • Ceir cynnal uchafswm o 3 chyfarfod yn ystod y flwyddyn ysgol.
  • Rhaid bod o leiaf 25 o ddiwrnodau ysgol ar ôl yn y flwyddyn ysgol.

Parents mat request up to 3 meetings with the Governing Body in any school year, to discuss issues that concern them. 4 requirements must be met:
Parents will need to submit a petition in favor of holding a meeting.

  • Parents of at least 10% of the registered pupils at the school / 30 pupils must sign the petition.
  • The meeting must be called to discuss issues affecting the school.
  • A maximum of 3 meetings may be conducted during the school year.
  • There must be at least 25 school days left in the school year.

Cymdeithas Rhieni-Athrawon / Ffrindiau Ysgol Bethel

Mae gan yr ysgol Gymdeithas Rhieni-Athrawon gref iawn sy'n gweithio'n galed iawn i godi arian er mwyn cyfoethogi addysg y plant drwy brynu adnoddau ychwanegol i'r ysgol. Trefnir gweithgareddau cymdeithasol, codi arian ac addysgiadol yn dymhorol.

Cynhelir Cyfarfod Blynyddol ym mis Hydref i ethol swyddogion a chynrychiolwyr i'r pwyllgor a chroesewir aelodau newydd. Mae copi o Gyfansoddiad y Gymdeithas ar gael gan y Pennaeth.

Parent-Teacher Association / Friends of Ysgol Bethel

The school has a strong and active Parent-Teacher Association, which works hard to raise monies in order to enrich the children's education by purchasing additional equipment for the school. Social, fundraising and educational activities are arranged each term.

An Annual Meeting is held in October to elect officials and representatives onto the committee and new members are welcome. A copy of the Association’s constitution is available from the headteacher.
Catref / Home

Cyngor Ysgol

Rydym, fel ysgol yn gwneud ein gorau i sicrhau awyrgylch dysgu diogel, hapus a theg i’r disgyblion. Mae’r Cyngor Ysgol yn rhoi cyfleoedd i ddisgyblion leisio eu pryderon a’u hanghenion. Cânt gyfleoedd i ddatblygu eu sgiliau datrys problemau mewn modd strwythuredig ac i gyfrannu’n ymarferol at benderfyniadau sydd yn ymwneud â hwy ac at rai materion rheolaethol.
Mae gweithrediad effeithiol Cyngor Ysgol yn datblygu ymwybyddiaeth y disgyblion o brosesau democrataidd ac yn datblygu ymdeimlad o gyfrifoldeb tuag at gymuned ac amgylchedd yr ysgol.

School Council

We, as a school endeavour to provide a secure, happy and fair learning environment for the pupils. The School Council provides opportunities for pupils to voice their worries and their needs. They are given opportunities to develop their problem solving skills in a structured manner and to contribute to decisions, which are relevant to them and to some managerial issues.
The effective operation of the School Council develops a feeling of responsibility towards the community and the environment of the school.

Patrwm Gwaith

Ceisir sicrhau bod yr addysg a ddarperir yn hybu datblygiad moesol, diwylliannol, meddyliol a chorfforol pob disgybl a bod natur y cwricwlwm cyflawn yn wahaniaethol, eang a chytbwys. I ymateb â'r gofynion hyn bydd trefniadaeth y dosbarth yn hyblyg; darperir gwaith ar sail oedran a/neu allu, neu dro arall bydd disgyblion o ystod oedran sy'n rhychwantu mwy nag un flwyddyn ysgol yn cydweithio ar yr un dasg. Addysgir y disgyblion fel uned dosbarth o dan ofal un athrawes/athro sefydlog.

Cynllunnir cwricwlwm yr Adran Iau ar sail naw agwedd ar ddysgu gan gynnwys y pynciau craidd a sylfaen, ac ar sail y Fframwaith Llythrennedd a Rhifedd a’r Fframwaith Sgiliau. Seilir cwricwlwm y Babanod ar Fframwaith y Cyfnod Sylfaen, Fframwaith Llythrennedd a Rhifedd a’r Fframwaith Sgiliau. Nodir cyfraniad y meysydd hyn mewn dull systematig yng nghofnodion yr athro/athrawes. Er mwyn sicrhau nag eithrir elfennau hanfodol o'r cwricwlwm cyflwynir y profiadau a'r gweithgareddau i blant yn draws-ddisgyblaethol drwy ddilyn themâu penodol.

Work Pattern

The aim is to try and ensure that the education provided enhances the spiritual, moral, cultural, mental and physical development of each pupil and that the nature of the complete curriculum is varied, expansive and balanced. In order to fulfil these needs the class organisation will be flexible; work will sometimes be given according to the child's age and/or ability, or at other times children of different age groups spanning more than one school year, will work together on one task. The children will be taught as a class unit in the care of one designated teacher.

The Junior Section’s curriculum is planned on the basis of nine aspects of learning including the core and foundation subjects, The Literacy and Numeracy Framework and the Skills Framework. The Infants Section’s curriculum is based on the Foundation Phase Framework, the Literacy and Numeracy Framework and the Skills Framework. The contribution of these subjects is noted systematically in the teachers' notes. By giving children tasks and experiences based on specific themes, or on an inter-disciplinary basis, the school will seek to ensure that other essential elements of the Curriculum are not forgotten.

Cinio Ysgol

Mae’r ysgol yn rhan o’r cynllun Ysgol Iach ac ymdrechir i adlewyrchu hyn ym mwydlen ginio’r ysgol. Cynigir dewis o salad a ffrwyth neu iogwrt yn ddyddiol.
A fyddech gystal â hysbysebu’r ysgol, yn ysgrifenedig, o unrhyw anghenion diet arbennig sydd gan eich plentyn.
Mae datblygu medrau trin cyllell a fforch a chymdeithasu yn bwysig i ddatblygiad cyflawn plentyn, felly anogwn chwi i roi cynnig ar ginio ysgol ar gyfer eich plentyn. Bydd digon o staff ar gael i gynorthwyo a goruchwylio eich plentyn. Cesglir arian cinio ar fore Llun gan yr ysgrifenyddes. Ni dderbynnir arian ar unrhyw ddiwrnod arall. Disgwylir i rieni dalu am ginio eu plant ymlaen llaw.
Disgwylir wythnos o rybudd os nad yw eich plentyn am barhau â chinio ysgol.

Bocs Bwyd a Byrbryd Amser Egwyl

Er mwyn hyrwyddo bwyta’n iach a gofal am y dannedd, gofynnwn yn garedig i chi gefnogi’r ymgyrch ‘Ysgol Iach’ wrth baratoi bocs bwyd eich plentyn. Awgrymir un peth melys yn unig, e.e. iogwrt neu fisged/teisen. Ni chaniateir melysion, siocled na diodydd sïol.
Ffrwythau yn unig a ganiateir yn ystod amser egwyl.

Llefrith

Mae Llywodraeth Cymru yn rhedeg cynllun sy'n cynnig llefrith am ddim i blant hyd at eu pen-blwydd yn 7 oed.

Dwr

Mae’r ysgol yn cydnabod pwysigrwydd yfed digon o ddwr yn ystod y dydd. Anogir y plant ddod â photel fach blastig o ddwr plaen heb flas i’r ysgol yn ddyddiol. Byddant yn cadw eu potel wrthlaw bob amser tra byddant yn gweithio a lleolir ffynnon ddwr yn y neuadd fach i’r plant gael ail-lenwi eu poteli.

School Lunch

The school is part of the Healthy Schools initiative and this is reflected in the school lunch menu. A choice of salad, fruit or yogurt is offered daily.
Please inform the school, in writing, of any special dietary needs that your child may have.
Developing knife and fork skills and socialization are important to the overall development of the child, so we encourage you to opt for a school lunch for your child. There will be plenty of staff available to assist and supervise your child with eating.
Dinner money is collected on Monday morning by the secretary. No money will be received on any other day. Parents are expected to pay for their children's meals in advance. The school requires a week’s notice if your child does not wish to continue with school lunches.

Lunchbox and Break Time Snacks

To promote healthy eating and tooth care, we kindly ask you to support the 'Healthy School' campaign when preparing your child's lunch box. One sweet thing only, e.g. yoghurt or biscuit / cake is recommended. Sweets, chocolate or fizzy drinks are not permitted.
Only fruits are allowed during break time.

Milk

The Welsh Government runs a scheme offering free milk to children up to the age of 7.


Water

The school recognizes the importance of drinking plenty of water during the day. Children are encouraged to bring a small plastic bottle of plain, unflavoured water to school daily. They will keep their bottle at hand at all times while they are working and a water fountain is located in the inner hall for children to refill their bottles

Gweithgareddau Ychwanegol

Gobeithia'r ysgol sicrhau cydweithrediad a chefnogaeth y rhieni gyda'r holl weithgareddau ychwanegol a drefnir.
Mae'r ysgol yn cynnig amrywiaeth o weithgareddau sy'n agored i holl ddisgyblion yr ysgol sydd ym marn y Pennaeth yn aeddfed ac yn barod i gymryd rhan ynddynt. Mae’r rhain yn cynnwys gweithgareddau a chlybiau chwaraeon, clybiau ar ôl ysgol a gweithgareddau’n arwain at berfformiadau cyhoeddus.
Ni all yr ysgol dderbyn cyfrifoldeb am oruchwylio plant ar derfyn sesiynau'r clybiau uchod, a gofynnir i rieni/gwarcheidwaid sicrhau eu bod yn gwneud trefniadau i hebrwng eu plant adref.
Bydd disgyblion yr Adran Iau yn derbyn cyfleoedd i gymryd rhan mewn gweithgareddau preswyl, e.e. Glanllyn, Caerdydd.

Urdd

Mae cangen lewyrchus o'r Urdd yn y pentref
Yn ogystal â gweithgareddau a drefnir yn ganolog gan y mudiad, eisteddfodau a gwersylla yng Nglanllyn yn bennaf, mae'r adran yn cyfarfod pob wythnos yn ystod tymhorau'r Nadolig a'r Gwanwyn, ac yn achlysurol yn ystod tymor yr Haf, i gynnal amrywiol weithgareddau cymdeithasol a diwylliannol drwy gyfrwng y Gymraeg.

Extra Activities

The school hopes to ensure the co-operation and the support of parents with all the additional activities arranged.
The school offers a variety of activities, which are open to all pupils who are in the headteacher's opinion ready and mature enough to take part in them. These include sport activities and club, out of school clubs and activities leading to public performances.
The school cannot accept responsibility for supervising children at the end of meetings of the above clubs/societies and parents/guardians are asked to ensure that arrangements are made for children to be taken home.
Junior pupils are given the opportunity to partake in residential courses, e.g. Glanllyn, Cardiff.

Urdd

There is a very active Urdd branch in the village.
As well as centrally organised activities, mainly 'Eisteddfodau' and weekend residential activities at Glanllyn, the Urdd branch meets weekly during the Christmas and Spring terms, and occasionally during the Summer term, to participate in various social and cultural activities through the medium of the Welsh language.
Catref / Home

Eiddo Personol

Nid yw'r Corff Llywodraethol yn derbyn cyfrifoldeb am unrhyw golled na difrod i eiddo personol plentyn, rhiant nac unrhyw unigolyn arall sydd ar dir yr ysgol unrhyw amser neu mewn unrhyw fan arall wrth ymwneud â gweithgareddau a drefnwyd gan yr ysgol. Trefn Gwyno

Mae gweithdrefnau’r ysgol i ddelio gyda chwynion yn cydymffurfio ag Adran 29 o Ddeddf Addysg 2002.
Mae tri cham i’r drefn gwyno, fel a nodir isod, a mawr hyderir y gellid delio gydag unrhyw gwyn cyn cyrraedd Cam 3.
  • Cam 1: Gwneir cwyn i’r derbynnydd cyntaf o fewn yr ysgol (e.e.athro/athrawes); rhoddir cyfle iddi hi / iddo ef i’w datrys. Os na cheir datrysiad, symud i gam 2.
  • Cam 2: Cyfeirio’r gwyn yn ysgrifenedig i’r pennaeth i ymchwilio iddi. Os na cheir datrysiad, symud i gam 3.
  • Cam 3: Cyfeirio’r mater i’r Corff Llywodraethu i ymchwilio iddo. Penderfynu arno a’i ddatrys.
Mae'r drefn hon wedi ei hamlinellu mewn dogfen bwrpasol yn y Gymraeg a'r Saesneg sydd ar gael yn yr ysgol ac ar wefan yr ysgol. Darperir copi'n rhad ac am ddim, yn ôl y gofyn, i unrhyw rieni sy'n dymuno gwneud cwyn dan y trefniadau, a gall yr Awdurdod ddarparu copi mewn iaith heblaw'r Gymraeg a'r Saesneg os bydd hynny'n angenrheidiol.

Pwysleisir, fodd bynnag, y gellir ymdrin â llawer o gwynion yn gyflym ac effeithiol drwy ystyriaeth anffurfiol yn seiliedig ar drafodaethau gyda'r athro/athrawes neu’r Pennaeth.

Bydd y Corff Llywodraethu'n disgwyl bod camau 1 a 2 wedi eu cyflawni cyn cyflwyno'r gwyn yn ffurfiol mewn achosion eithriadol.

Complaints Procedure

The school’s complaints procedures comply with the 2002 Education Act.
There are three steps to the complaints procedures and we hope that any problem can be resolved before reaching Step 3.
  • Step 1: The complaint is lodged with the first recipient within the school (e.g. teacher); he/she is has the opportunity to resolve the problem. If there is no resolution, move to Step 2.
  • Step 2: The matter is referred to the headteacher to investigate, decide upon and resolve. If there is no resolution, move to Step 3.
  • Step 3: The matter is referred to the governing body to investigate, decide and resolve.

This procedure is outlined in a document in Welsh and English, which is available at the school. A copy will be provided free of charge as required to any parent seeking to make a complaint under these arrangements and the Local Authority can, if necessary, provide a copy in a language other than Welsh or English.

It is emphasised, however, that many complaints can be dealt with quickly and effectively by informal consideration based on discussions with the teacher or headteacher.

The Governing body would expect that steps 1 and 2 would have been completed before presenting the complaint formally in exceptional cases.

Gwisg Ysgol / School Uniform

Mae gan yr ysgol hon wisg ysgol swyddogol. Mae'r wisg yn cynnwys crys polo glas golau/crys t, crys chwys glas tywyll/hwdi, sgert neu drowsus llwyd/du, (dim trowsusau chwaraeon na jîns) ac esgidiau neu drainyrs addas. Ni chaniateir sodlau na fflipfflops.

Yn yr Haf caniateir gwisgo trowsus byr neu dri-chwarter llwyd/du neu ffrog las a gwyn (gingham) i'r genethod.
Disgwylir i'r plant fod wedi eu gwisgo'n lân a thrwsiadus, a bod eu dillad yn cydymffurfio â’r wisg ysgol. Gofynnwn yn garedig am eich cefnogaeth gyda'r wisg ysgol.
Gellir archebu crysau polo/crysau t a chrysau chwys/hwdis drwy’r ysgol unwaith y tymor.

Cyfrifoldeb rhieni yw sicrhau bod enw eu plentyn wedi ei bwytho/ysgrifennu ar bob dilledyn y mae’n ei wisgo neu’n newid iddo fel rhan o weithgareddau’r ysgol.

Ni chaniateir gwisgo clustlysau yn yr ysgol ag eithrio 'stỳds'.

This school has an official uniform. The uniform includes a light blue polo shirt/t-shirt, a dark blue sweatshirt/hoodie, grey/black skirt or trousers, (not sports trousers or jeans), and suitable shoes or trainers. Heels and flip-flops are not permitted.

In the summer the children can wear grey/ black shorts/three quarter length trousers or a blue and white gingham dress for the girls.
The children are expected to be neatly dressed in clothes, which conform to the school uniform. We respectfully request your co-operation with the school uniform. Polo/T shirts and sweatshirts/hoodies may be ordered through the school once a term.

It is the parent’s responsibility to ensure that their child's name is sewn/written on each piece of clothing worn or changed into as part of the school's activities.

The wearing of earrings is not permitted in school, with the exception of 'studs'

Cyfle Cyfartal / Equal Opporunities

  • Yn unol â Deddf Cysylltiadau Hiliol (Diwygiedig) 2000, mae’r ysgol wedi ymrwymo i hyrwyddo cyfleoedd cyfartal, i hyrwyddo cysylltiadau da rhwng aelodau gwahanol grwpiau a chymunedau hiliol, diwylliannol a chrefyddol ac i gael gwared â gwahaniaethu anghyfreithlon ar sail hil neu ryw.
  • Datblygir disgyblion Ysgol Bethel heb ganiatáu i’w rhyw, hil neu unrhyw nodweddion personol eraill fod yn rhwystr i hynny. Yn yr un modd cyflogir unigolion heb ganiatáu i’w rhyw, hil neu unrhyw nodweddion personol eraill fod yn rhwystr i hynny.
  • Darperir cydraddoldeb cyfle yn yr ysgol i ddisgyblion a staff, dysgu ac atodol.
  • Datblygir cydraddoldeb cyfle a pharch yn yr ysgol rhwng bechgyn a genethod, rhwng oedolion, rhwng plant ac oedolion a’r gwrthwyneb.
  • Ehangir gorwelion bechgyn a genethod drwy greu amgylchedd lle ni cheir gwahaniaethu ar sail rhyw a lle herir ystrydebau traddodiadol.
  • Hyrwyddir cyfleoedd cyfartal i ferched a bechgyn ar draws y cwricwlwm. Nid yw’r athrawon na’r staff atodol yn gosod disgwyliadau gwahanol i ferched a bechgyn.
  • Mae’n anghyfreithlon ym Mhrydain Fawr i wahaniaethu o ran rhyw wrth benodi, diswyddo neu’n dyrchafu swyddi. Sicrheir bod Ysgol Bethel yn glynu wrth yr Erthyglau Llywodraethu a’r Ddeddf Gwahaniaethu ar Sail Rhyw 1975 wrth benodi staff.
  • Mabwysiadwyd polisi Cydraddoldeb Hiliol gan yr ysgol, sydd yn nodi ymrwymiad yr ysgol i hyrwyddo cyfle cyfartal, hyrwyddo cysylltiadau da rhwng aelodau gwahanol grwpiau a chymunedau hiliol, diwylliannol a chrefyddol ac i osgoi gwahaniaethau anghyfreithlon.
  • Ni adroddwyd ar unrhyw achos o hiliaeth yn yr ysgol.

  • According to the (amended) Race Relations Act 2000, the school is commited to promote equal opportunities, to promote good relations between members of different cultural, ethnic and religious groups and to be free of any illegal differentiation based on race or sex.
  • The children of Ysgol Bethel are developed without allowing their sex, race or any other personal characteristics to influence that development. In the same way, individuals are employed ensuring that their sex, race or any personal characteristics do not influence any appointments.
  • Equal opportunities are offered at the school to children and staff, teaching and ancillary.
  • Equal opportunities and respect are fostered and developed at the school between boys and girls, between adults, between children and adults and vice-versa.
  • Both girls’ and boys’ horizons are expanded in an atmosphere which does not differentiate according to sex and which challenges traditional concepts.
  • Equal opportunities across the curriculum are encouraged for boys and girls. The teaching and ancillary staff does not set different expectations for boys and girls.
  • It is unlawful in the United Kingdom to differentiate according to sex when appointing, dismissing or promoting staff. Ysgol Bethel adopts the Governing Articles and the 1975 Sex Discrimination Act when appointing staff.
  • The School has adopted a Racial Equality Policy, which involves promoting equal opportunities, promoting good relationships with members of different racial, cultural and religious groups and communities, and avoiding illegal differentiation.
  • No case of racial discrimination has been reported at the school.

Cyswllt a Rhieni / Links with Parents

Gweithredir polisi 'drws agored' yn yr ysgol lle mae rhyddid a chroeso i rieni, drwy drefnu apwyntiad ymlaen llaw, i ymweld â'r ysgol i drafod unrhyw agwedd ar addysg, lles neu hapusrwydd eu plant. Rydym i gyd yn cydweithio er lles pob plentyn yn yr ysgol.

Parents are invited to the school to see and discuss their child's work and development twice a year, in the Autumn and Summer terms. Parents and friends of the school are also invited to attend concerts etc. to watch the children perform. Parents are invited to an annual end of year service.

Nofio / Swimming

Fe gynhelir gwersi nofio am dymor i Flynyddoedd 3 & 4 ac am hanner tymor i Flynyddoedd 2,5&6 yn ystod y flwyddyn. Fe fydd y plant yn nofio ar fore Gwener drwy'r flwyddyn ysgol. Mae'r gwersi'n rhan o weithgareddau'r ysgol, ac fe ddisgwylir i bob plentyn sydd yn yr ysgol yn y bore fynychu'r gwersi. Gofynnir yn garedig i rieni hysbysu'r pennaeth, drwy lythyr, os na fydd plentyn yn mynd i’r dwr neu os fydd ag apwyntiad meddygol yn y bore.

Gofynnir yn garedig i'r rhieni gyfrannu at gost y cludiant.

Swimming lessons will be held termly for years 3&5 and half termly for Years 2,5&6 during the year. The children will be swimming on Friday mornings throughout the school year. The lessons will be held in the pool at Arfon Leisure Centre. The lessons are for the Junior Section and Years 1 and 2. You will be informed in good time if your child will be attending.

The lessons are considered part of the school's activities, and as such, every child present in the morning is expected to attend. Parents are kindly requested to inform the headteacher, in writing, if a child will not be going in the water or has a medical appointment in the morning.

Girls are requested to wear a one-piece swimming costume. Bikinis are not suitable for swimming lessons.

Anghenion Addysgol Arbennig / Special Educational Needs


The SEN coordinator: Mr Dylan Parry
The Designated Governor: Mrs Carol Owen

Egwyddorion
Mae Ysgol Bethel yn anelu at sicrhau cyfle cyfartal cwricwlaidd a chymdeithasol i ddisgyblion ag anghenion addysgol arbennig. Rydym yn gweithio’n agos gyda rhieni er mwyn sicrhau partneriaeth effeithiol i helpu’r disgybl. Rydym yn cydweithio’n effeithiol ag asiantaethau statudol a gwasanaethau eraill sydd yn berthnasol i’r plentyn a’i anawsterau. Rhoddir pwyslais ar gyfraniad y disgybl ac ystyriaeth i’w farn. Ceisiwn sicrhau ymateb ysgol gyfan i helpu’r disgybl.

Amcanion
  • Sicrhau bod cyfundrefn yn bodoli yn yr ysgol i adnabod yn gynnar y plentyn sydd ag anawsterau a all fod yn llesteirio ei addysg.
  • Casglu gwybodaeth ynghyd gan athrawon, rhieni, y disgybl ac eraill i sicrhau y ceir y ddealltwriaeth orau am natur anawsterau’r plentyn.
  • Sicrhau y caiff y ddarpariaeth angenrheidiol ei gwneud ar gyfer unrhyw ddisgybl sydd ag anghenion addysgol arbennig.
  • Ceisio sicrhau cydweithrediad a chefnogaeth y rhieni ac eraill mewn perthynas ag adnabod a darparu gwasanaeth.

Darpariaeth
Bydd yr ysgol yn darparu cefnogaeth sensitif a phriodol er mwyn sicrhau y bydd y disgybl yn cael ei gynnwys yn holl weithgareddau’r ysgol, fel y bo modd. Dilynnir Côd Ymarfer Comisiwn Hawliau’r Anabl (Ysgolion) a’r Ddeddf AAA ac Anabledd 2001.

Bydd pob disgybl ag AAA yn dilyn y cwricwlwm gyda disgyblion eraill. Os cyfyd anawsterau, yna:
  • rhoddir sylw unigol fewn y dosbarth
  • paratoir gwaith gwahaniaethol gan yr athrawon dosbarth a chan yr athrawes AAA
  • ymgynghorir gydag asiantaethau cynhaliol
  • cynhelir trafodaethau gyda rhieni
  • llunir cynllun addysg unigol i ddisgyblion o fewn Cymorth gan yr Ysgol, Cymorth gan yr Ysgol a Mwy ac ar gyfer disgyblion sydd ar Ddatganiad

Darperir cefnogaeth mewn grwpiau bychan i rai disgyblion yn wythnosol, yn bennaf er mwyn datblygu llythrennedd a bydd rhai yn derbyn sylw wythnosol gan athrawes AAA yr Awdurdod Addysg. Gall yr AALl drefnu lleoliad mewn Unedau Arbennig i rai disgyblion.

Principles
Ysgol Bethel aims to ensure equal curricular and social opportunities for every pupil who has special educational needs. We work closely with parents in order to promote an effective partnership which will benefit the pupil. We work closely with statutory agencies and other services relevant to the pupil’s needs. There is emphasis on the child’s contribution and his opinion is considered. We aim for a whole school response to help the pupil.


Aims
  • Ensure that there are procedures in place in the school to recognise early a child who has difficulties which may inhibit his learning.
  • Gather information from teachers, parents, the pupil and others to ensure the best possible understanding of the nature of the pupil’s needs
  • Ensure that the necessary provision is made for any pupil who has special educational needs.
  • Try to ensure the co-operation and support of the parents and others in relation to recognising and providing a service.

Provision
The school provides a sensitive and appropriate response in order to ensure that the pupils are included in all the school’s activities, if at all possible. The Code of Practice for the Disability Rights Commission and the SEN and Disability Act 2001 are followed.

Every SEN pupil will follow the curriculum. Should difficulties arise, then:
  • The child will receive attention within the class
  • Differentiated work will be provided by the class teacher or the SEN teacher
  • Support agencies will be contacted
  • Discussions with parents will occur
  • An individual lesson plan will be created for those on ‘School Action’, ‘School Action Plus and for pupils who are Statemented.

Weekly support within a small group is provided for some pupils, mainly to develop literacy and some pupils receive weekly sessions with the Education Authority’s SEN teacher. The LEA may provide some pupils with a placement in a specialised unit.

Disgyblion Anabl / Disabled Children

Derbyn
Mae’r ysgol yn derbyn disgyblion ag AAA i’r ysgol trwy:

  • gydweithio gyda’r asiantaethau cynnal wrth dderbyn disgybl o’r newydd
  • fynychu cyfarfodydd swyddogol, fel adolygiadau datganiadau,
  • drafodaethau a derbyn gwybodaeth, e.e., symud o ysgol i ysgol
  • drafod â rhieni
  • ymdrin â’r cais mewn dull cadarnhaol
  • ddarparu cefnogaeth sensitif a phriodol er mwyn sicrhau y bydd y disgybl yn cael ei gynnwys yn holl weithgareddau’r ysgol yn unol â Deddf Hawliau’r Anabl.
Mynediad i’r Anabl
Gosodwyd llethrau a chanllawiau ar gyfer mynediad i’r anabl ac mae canllawiau ar y grisiau sydd yn arwain i’r caban ac i’r neuadd. Mae llethr symudol ar gyfer y grisiau sydd yn arwain at y neuadd. Mae canllawiau ar gyfer disgyblion anabl mewn un toiled yn Adran y Babanod, yn nhoiledau bechygyn yr Adran Iau, yn y caban ac yn y caban newydd. Mae bwriad i osod canllawiau mewn toiled arall yn Adran y Babanod. Mae toiled anabl i oedolion yn yr adeilad. Gosodwyd llethrau ar gyfer mynediad i'r anabl yn Adran y Babanod a'r Adran Iau.
Buasai'r Llywodraethwyr yn gefnogol i unrhyw addasiadau a fyddai angen eu gwneud i’r adeilad ar gyfer derbyn plentyn neu oedolyn gydag anabledd.
Admitting
The school accepts children who have SEN by:

  • working in conjunction with support agencies when accepting a new pupil
  • attending meetings, such as review meetings
  • discussions and receiving information, e.g. changing schools,
  • discussing with parents
  • treating the request in a positive manner
  • provide sensitive and relevant support in order to ensure that the pupil is included in all the school’s activities, according to The Disability Act.
Access for the Disabled
Ramps and handrails have been built by two entrances for disabled access. Handrails have been placed on the steps leading to the cabin and the main hall. There is a moveable ramp for the steps leading to the main hall. There are handrails for disabled pupils in one toilet in the Infants Section, in the boys' toilet in the Junior Section, in the cabin and in the new cabin. Further handrails are scheduled for another toilet in the Infants section. There is a disabled toilet for adults in the building. Ramps have been built for disabled access into the Infants and Junior section
The Governors would support any necessary adaptations to the building to receive a disabled child or adult.

Dosbarthu Moddion i Blant / Administering Medicines to Children

Oherwydd rhesymau Iechyd a Diogelwch, ni all yr ysgol gymryd cyfrifoldeb dros ddosbarthu unrhyw fath o foddion, (gan gynnwys Calpol) i blant, ond gallwch, pe dymunwch, ddod i wneud hynny, neu yrru cynrychiolydd ar eich rhan.
Os yw plentyn yn derbyn cwrs o wrth-biotig ac yn ddigon da i fynychu’r ysgol, gellid gofyn i’r meddyg am ddogn i’w gymryd ddwywaith y dydd. Ni chaniateir da-da annwyd, megis Tunes, a.y.y.b.

Mewn achlysuron arbennig, e.e. plentyn sydd â salwch tymor hir, neu blentyn sydd yn ddibynnol ar feddyginiaeth ddyddiol, gellid gwneud trefniadau drwy gysylltu â’r Pennaeth. Mewn achosion o’r math, gofynnir am gyfarwyddiadau ysgrifenedig gan feddyg y plentyn.
Os bydd plentyn yn sâl yn ystod y dydd, bydd yr ysgol yn cysylltu â’r cartref / rhif cyswllt a ddarparwyd.
Due to Health and safety restrictions, the school cannot accept responsibility for administering any kind of medicine, (including Calpol) to children, but you may, should you wish, come in to do so yourself or send a representative on your behalf.
If a child is on a course of antibiotics and well enough to attend school, it is possible to ask the doctor for a twice-daily dose. Cold sweets, such as Tunes etc. are not allowed.


In special circumstances, e.g. if a child suffers from a long term illness or is dependent on daily medicine, arrangements can be made by contacting the Headteacher. In such cases, written instructions by the child’s doctor will be needed..
If a child is ill during the day, the school will contact the home/contact number provided.

Addysg Rhyw / Sex Education

Mae’r ysgol wedi ymateb i ofynion Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru i weithredu rhaglen ‘Addysg Rhyw a Pherthnasoedd’. Defnyddir fframwaith ABCh a’r Cwricwlwm Gwyddoniaeth fel sylfaen. Y nod yw meithrin hunan barch a deallusrwydd bechgyn a genethod o’u cyrff eu hunain drwy ymdrîn â materion rhywiol mewn ffordd sensitif a chan feithrin agwedd iach ac aeddfed tuag at brosesau bywyd a materion rhywiol.

Ymdrechir i ateb unrhyw gwestiynau sydd yn codi’n naturiol gan y plant ac fe ymdrinnir â'r maes mewn modd sensitif a synhwyrol gan bwysleisio’r perthynas teuluol a chariadus. Mae hawl gan rieni i eithrio’u plant o rannau o’r gwersi Addysg Rhyw. Gallech, pe dymunwch, ymgynghori â'r Pennaeth ynghylch polisi’r ysgol ar Addysg Rhyw.
The school has reacted to the Welsh Assembly’s requirement to provide a ‘Sex and Relationships’ education program, the basis of which is the PSE Framework and the Science Curriculum. The aim is to develop boys and girls’ self-respect and understanding of their own bodies by dealing with aspects of a sexual nature in a sensitive manner and by developing a healthy and mature attitude towards life processes and sexual matters.

Any questions that may naturally arise will be answered appropriately. All matters will be dealt with in a sensitive and sensible manner with emphasis on loving and family relationships. Parents may remove their child from some of the Sex Education lessons. You may, should you wish, consult the Headteacher concerning the school’s policy on Sex Education.

Crefydd / Religion

Nid yw'r ysgol hon yn dal cysylltiad uniongyrchol a ffurfiol ag unrhyw enwad crefyddol. Y mae'r addysg grefyddol a gyflwynir yn seiliedig ar faes llafur cydnabyddedig yr Awdurdod. Gellir archwilio copi o'r maes llafur hwn yn yr ysgol. Fe fydd y plant yn cydaddoli yn ddyddiol fel ysgol, fel adran neu fel dosbarth.

Fe ellir gwneud trefniadau ar gyfer plant nad yw eu rhieni am iddynt fynychu'r gwasanaethau crefyddol neu astudiaethau cyffelyb.
The school has no direct or formal affiliation. The religious education provided is based on the Authority's agreed syllabus, a copy of which may be examined at the school. The children will worship collectively on a daily basis as a school, as a unit or as a class.


Suitable arrangements can be made for children whose parents object to them receiving religious instruction or attending religious services.

Iaith / Language

Amcanion Cyffredinol
Mae Awdurdod Addysg Gwynedd yn gweithredu polisi dwyieithog trwy holl ysgolion Gwynedd a hefyd yn datblygu polisi dwyieithog ar gyfer sefydliadau Addysg Bellach.
Yr amcan yw datblygu gallu disgyblion a myfyrwyr y sir i fod yn hyderus ddwyieithog er mwyn eu galluogi i fod yn aelodau cyflawn o'r gymdeithas ddwyieithog y maent yn rhan ohoni.
Dylai holl sefydliadau addysg y sir adlewyrchu ac atgyfnerthu'r polisi iaith yn eu gweinyddiad, eu bywyd cymdeithasol a'u trefn fugeiliol yn ogystal ag yn eu darpariaeth academaidd.



Amcanion Penodol

Addysg Feithrin
Sicrhau, trwy ddarpariaeth a threfniadaeth feithrin bwrpasol a sensitif, y rhoddir i bob plentyn sylfaen gadarn yn y Gymraeg er mwyn ei alluogi i gyrraedd y nod o ddwyieithrwydd llawn maes o law.

Babanod
Adeiladu ar y sylfeini a osodwyd i'r Gymraeg drwy addysg feithrin, cadarnhau a datblygu mamiaith y plentyn o ddysgwyr Cymraeg ac ymestyn gafael y plentyn o gartref Cymraeg ar y Saesneg.

Iau
Cadarnhau a datblygu Cymraeg a Saesneg pob plentyn yn eu holl agweddau goddefol a gweithredol, er mwyn sicrhau ei fod yn gallu siarad, darllen ac ysgrifennu'n rhwydd ac yn hyderus yn y ddwy iaith pan fo'n trosglwyddo i'r ysgol uwchradd.
Gwneir darpariaeth arbennig ar gyfer hwyrddyfodiad.
Bydd y Pennaeth, mewn ymgynghoriad â'r staff, yn paratoi ac adolygu'n rheolaidd ddogfen sy'n datgan sut mae'r ysgol yn bwriadu gweithredu polisi iaith yr Awdurdod Addysg a amlinellir uchod.

Am fwy or manylion

General Aims
Gwynedd Education Authority operates a bilingual policy in all its schools and is also developing a bilingual policy for the Further Education establishments within the county.
The aim is to develop the ability of pupils and students within the county to be confidently bilingual in order that they can be full members of the bilingual society of which they are a part.
All educational establishments within the county should reflect and reinforce the language policy in their administration, their social life and pastoral arrangements as well as their academic provision.

Specific Aims

Nursery Education
To ensure, through sensitively structured provision and organisation, that each child receives a firm foundation in Welsh in order to enable him/her, in due course, to achieve the aim of full bilingualism.

Infants
To build on the Welsh Language foundation laid through nursery education, to consolidate and develop the mother tongue of children who are Welsh learners and extend the children from a Welsh speaking home's competence in English.

Juniors
To consolidate and develop each child's Welsh and English capabilities in all aspects, both active and receptive, so as to ensure that he/she can speak, read and write fluently and confidently in both languages on transferring to the secondary school.
Special provision will be made for junior latecomers.
The Headteacher, in consultation with the staff and Governors, will prepare and regularly review a document, which states how the school intends to operate the Education Authority's Language policy as outlined above.

Gwaith Catref / Homework

Gosodir gwaith cartref ffurfiol o leiaf unwaith yr wythnos, fel arfer ar brynhawn Iau, i'w ddychwelyd erbyn bore Llun, a rhoddir cryn bwyslais ar ei gyflawni. Bydd y plant yn gweithio ar themâu neu brosiectau unigol neu ar weithgareddau datblygu sgiliau a phan ddigwydd hynny gobeithir y bydd y cartref yn cydweithredu i hybu gwaith y plant.

Ambell i dro bydd gweithgarwch arbennig yn gofyn am wybodaeth gan rieni a pherthnasau a chymdogion, neu'n gofyn am waith holi a darganfod ar ran y plant. Sylweddolir mai cyfrifoldeb y cartref yw'r plentyn yn ystod yr oriau hyn ac mai yng ngoleuni'r cyfrifoldeb hwnnw y bydd rhieni yn cytuno neu'n anghytuno i gydweithredu.

Mae trefn darllen gartref yn bodoli ac ymbiliwn ar rieni i sicrhau bod eu plant yn darllen yn ddyddiol. Bydd y plant yn cludo eu llyfrau yn ôl ac ymlaen o’r ysgol yn ddyddiol. Disgwylir i rieni nodi 5 cofnod darllen yn y llyfrau cofnodi darllen yn wythnosol.

O dro i dro fe all athro/athrawes ofyn i blentyn wneud gwaith ychwanegol er mwyn dileu rhyw wendid neu ganolbwyntio ar agwedd arbennig o'r gwaith. Bryd hynny gobeithir cael cydweithrediad llwyr y cartref ac anogaeth i'r plentyn i wneud y gwaith.

Formal homework is set at least once a week, usually on a Thursday, to be returned by Monday, and importance is placed on completing it. The children will work on particular themes or projects or skill development activities. When this happens, it is hoped that the home will co-operate to encourage the child in his/her work.

From time to time a particular activity requires information by parents, relations and neighbours, or requires interviewing and research work by the child. It is appreciated that the child is the responsibility of the home during these hours and parents' willingness to co-operate will be understood in the light of this responsibility.

A home reading scheme exists and we entreat parents to ensure that their children read daily. Books will be carried to and from school daily. It is expected that parents note 5 reading records a week in the reading record book.

Occasionally, a particular teacher may ask a child to do additional work in order to overcome some weakness or to concentrate on a special aspect of work. At such times it is hoped that the full co-operation of the home will be forthcoming together with encouragement necessary for the child to do the work.

Anghenion Addysgol Arbennig / Special Educational Needs


Cydgysylltydd Amddiffyn Plant / Child Protection Co-ordinator: Mrs Nia Guillemin
Llywodraethwr Amddiffyn plant / Child Protection Governor: Mrs Carol Owen

Mae Ysgol Bethel yn cydnabod yn llawn y cyfraniad y mae’n ei wneud i amddiffyn plant. Mae tair prif elfen yn ein polisi:-
  • Atal drwy’r addysgu a’r cymorth bugeiliol sy’n cael ei gynnig i ddisgyblion;
  • Gweithdrefnau ar gyfer adnabod achosion neu amheuon o gam-drin ac adrodd arnynt. Oherwydd ein cysylltiad beunyddiol â phlant, mae staff yr ysgol mewn sefyllfa dda i sylwi ar unrhyw arwyddion allanol o gam-drin. Byddwn yn glynu at Weithdrefnau Amddiffyn Plant Cymru Gyfan sydd wedi cael eu cadarnhau gan y Bwrdd Diogelu Plant Lleol
  • Cefnogi disgyblion a allai fod wedi cael eu cam-drin.

Mae ein polisi’n berthnasol i’r holl staff a gwirfoddolwyr sy’n gweithio yn yr ysgol, ac i’r llywodraethwyr.

Bydd cydgysylltydd Amdiffyn Plant yr ysgol yn cyfeirio unrhyw achos o bryder i’r Adran berthnasol o’r Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol.

Ceir copi llawn o’r polisi a’r gweithdrefnau yn rhad ac am ddim trwy gysylltu â’r ysgol neu trwy fynd ar safwe’r ysgol.
Ysgol Bethel fully recognises the contribution it makes to child protection. There are three main elements to our policy:-
  • Prevention through the teaching and pastoral support offered to pupils.
  • Procedures for identifying and reporting cases, or suspected cases, of abuse. Because of our day to day contact with children school staff are well placed to observe the outward signs of abuse. We will follow the All Wales Child Protection Procedures that have been endorsed by the Local Safeguarding Children Board.
  • Support to pupils who may have been abused.


Our policy applies to all staff and volunteers working in the school and governors.


The school’s Child Protection co-ordinator will refer any cause for concern to the relevant department of the Social Services.

A copy of the full policy and procedures may be obtained free of charge by contacting the school or on the school’s website.

Addysg Gorfforol / Physical Education

Mae'r ysgol, mewn partneriaeth â'r cartref, yn gyfrifol am ddatblygiad corfforol pob plentyn, yn ogystal â'i ddatblygiad addysgol a moesol. Felly, cynhelir gwersi Addysg Gorfforol o leiaf unwaith yr wythnos i adrannau'r Babanod ac Iau yng nghampfa'r ysgol, ar y buarthau, ar y cae, yn y pwll nofio yn y Ganolfan Hamdden neu yn y ganolfan tenis. Bydd mangre'r gwersi'n dibynnu ar ba uned o waith bydd y dosbarth yn ymdrin ag ar y tywydd.

Ein nod yw datblygu cryfder, rheolaeth ac esthetrwydd y plant trwy eu cael i fod yn gorfforol weithgar. Byddent hefyd yn cael cyfleoedd i weithio'n annibynnol a chydweithio ag eraill ac i lunio a rheoli gemau eu hunain.

Yn ddibynnol ar y fangre, disgwylir i'r plant wisgo dillad priodol ar gyfer y gwersi. Golyga hyn newid cyflawn o'u gwisg uchaf h.y. pâr o siortiau chwaraeon plaen (dim denim) a chrys T chwaraeon gwyn (nid festiau). Byddant angen treinyrs ar gyfer gweithgareddau ar y buarthau / cae. Ni chaniateir gwisgo unrhyw bympiau ar gyfer gweithgraeddau yn y neuadd ag eithrio’r plant sydd â chlefyd ar eu traed.

Ni chaniateir gwisgo modrwyau, clustlysau nac oriawr mewn unrhyw wers Addysg Gorfforol, (gwerthfawrogir petai’r plant yn eu gadael adref ar ddyddiau Addysg Gorfforol).


Os oes unrhyw reswm meddygol pam na all plentyn gymryd rhan mewn gwersi Addysg Gorfforol, gofynnir yn garedig i'r rhieni hysbysu'r ysgol yn ysgrifenedig.

Yn ddibynnol ar y tywydd, ymdrechir trefnu gemau rygbi, peldroed neu bêl-rwyd gyda ysgolion eraill, mynychu twrnamentau yng Nghanolfannau Hamdden Arfon a mynychu gala nofio Ysgolion Arfon.
The school, in partnership with the home, is responsible for every child's physical development as well as his/her educational and moral development. Consequently, Physical Education lessons for the Infant and Junior Classes are held at least once a week in the school hall, the field, the schoolyard, the swimming pool at the Leisure Centre or the Tennis Centre. The venue for the lessons will depend on which unit the class will be following and upon the weather.

Our aim is to develop strength, control and an aesthetic appreciation by getting the children physically active. They will also have opportunities to work independently and with others and to form and regulate their own games.

Depending on the venue, the children are expected to wear appropriate clothing for each lesson. This means a complete set of outer-wear, i.e. a pair of plain sports shorts (not denim) and a white sports T-shirt (not vest tops). Trainers will be needed for activities on the yard/ field. The wearing of pumps is not permitted for activities in the school hall except when children have a foot infection.

The wearing of rings, earrings and watches will not be allowed in any Physical Education lessons, (it would be appreciated if the children left them at home on Physical Education days).

If children are unable to participate because of illness or injury, parents are kindly requested to inform the class teacher in writing.

Depending on the weather, we will attempt to arrange rugby, football or netball games against other schools in the area, participate in tournaments in the Arfon Leisure Centre and to participate in the swimming gala for Arfon Schools.
